<title
    level="1"
    right="Item 1+"
    pfs=""
>
[Portable Weapon Mount](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1219)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 182</row>

_[**PFS Note**](/pathfinder-society) Characters with access to firearms gain access to accessories that can be used with those weapons._

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** 1
</row>

<row gap="medium">

 

 

 
</row>

</column>

---

Powerful firearms like the [arquebus](/Weapons.aspx?ID=195) were originally used to defend fortifications or ships, mounted on casements or pintles to steady their aim and offset their recoil. More mobile means of stabilizing weapons with [kickback](/Traits.aspx?ID=409) were developed as firearms began to spread across the Inner Sea. The standard [tripod](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1207) takes an Interact action to deploy using one hand.

<column gap="tiny">

</column>

<title
level="2"
right="Item 1"
pfs="Standard"
>
Portable Weapon Mount (Monopod)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 182</row>

**Price** 2 sp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** 1

</row>

</column>

---

Monopods are lighter and can be deployed with a single hand using the same action as drawing the firearm. They still require an Interact action to retrieve. Monopods are less stable than a tripod, and firing a kickback weapon from a monopod without the necessary Strength reduces the penalty to a –1 circumstance penalty instead of removing it entirely.

<title
level="2"
right="Item 3"
pfs="Standard"
>
Portable Weapon Mount (Tripod, Shielded)
</title>

<traits>

</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Guns & Gears](/Sources.aspx?ID=98) pg. 182</row>

**Price** 50 gp

<row gap="medium">

**Bulk** 5

</row>

</column>

---

A shielded tripod resembles a squat shield on a tripod. You can deploy and retrieve a shielded tripod with an Interact action, as normal, but while a shielded tripod is in your square, you can use the [Take Cover](/Actions.aspx?ID=90) action to gain standard cover behind the tripod's shield. You can't use this cover to Hide or Sneak, as normal for times when your cover still leaves your position obvious.
name: Portable Weapon Mount (Monopod)
